metadata.description: Complete element type definitions for FFMQ. Element types are 16-bit bitfield values used in enemy resistances/weaknesses, attack properties, and spell effects.
metadata.source: FFMQ Randomizer (FFMQRLib/Enemies.cs ElementsType enum) + ROM analysis

element_types.name: Silence
element_types.description: Prevents the target from casting magic spells. Affects magic ability usage.

element_types.name: Blind
element_types.description: Reduces the target's accuracy, making physical attacks more likely to miss.

element_types.name: Poison
element_types.description: Deals continuous HP damage over time. Target takes damage at regular intervals.

element_types.name: Confusion
element_types.description: Target acts randomly and may attack allies or use incorrect actions.

element_types.name: Sleep
element_types.description: Target cannot act until awakened. Taking damage typically removes sleep.

element_types.name: Paralysis
element_types.description: Target is immobilized and cannot take any actions for the duration.

element_types.name: Stone
element_types.description: Target is petrified. In battle, this usually means instant defeat.

element_types.name: Doom
element_types.description: Target will be KO'd after a countdown expires. Typically irreversible.

element_types.name: Projectile
element_types.description: Damage from projectile-based attacks (arrows, thrown weapons, etc.).

element_types.name: Bomb
element_types.description: Explosive damage type. Often associated with bomb enemies or explosive attacks.

element_types.name: Axe
element_types.description: Damage from axe weapons. Some enemies are resistant or weak to axe-type attacks.

element_types.name: Zombie
element_types.description: Undead/zombie type. Reverses resistance logic (resistant to healing, weak to life magic).

element_types.name: Air
element_types.description: Wind/Air elemental damage. One of the four primary elements aligned with crystals.

element_types.name: Fire
element_types.description: Fire elemental damage. One of the four primary elements aligned with crystals.

element_types.name: Water
element_types.description: Water/Ice elemental damage. One of the four primary elements aligned with crystals.

element_types.name: Earth
element_types.description: Earth/Ground elemental damage. One of the four primary elements aligned with crystals.

usage_notes.enemy_resistances: When an enemy has a resistance bit set, damage from that element type is halved. EXCEPTION: Zombie type reverses this - healing becomes harmful, life magic becomes effective.
usage_notes.enemy_weaknesses: When an enemy has a weakness bit set, damage from that element type is doubled. This makes battles significantly easier if you exploit weaknesses.
usage_notes.attack_properties: Attacks and spells can have multiple element type bits set. For example, an attack might be both Fire element AND inflict Poison status.
usage_notes.spell_effects: White magic typically has no element type (pure healing). Black magic often has elemental properties (Fire, Water, Air, Earth). Wizard magic may combine multiple elements.
usage_notes.bitfield_usage: Element types are stored as 16-bit values. Multiple types can be combined using bitwise OR. Example: 0x2004 = Fire (0x2000) + Poison (0x0004).
usage_notes.resistance_weakness_interaction: If an enemy is BOTH resistant AND weak to the same element (unusual but possible), the effects typically cancel out to normal damage.

salamander_resistances.description: Salamander is resistant to Fire attacks - fire damage is halved

freeze_crab_weaknesses.description: Freeze Crab is weak to Fire attacks - fire damage is doubled

zombie_type.description: Undead enemies with Zombie type reverse healing - Cure damages them, Life magic is effective

multi_element_attack.description: An attack that deals Fire and Air elemental damage while also potentially inflicting Poison status
